parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
A horse. Of uncertain affinity; a horse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
True (lit: made of truth), real, genuine. From alethes; truthful.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make war, contend, fight, battle. From polemos; to be in warfare, i.e. To battle: -fight, war.
